ygData.subject: Re: Wizards
ygData.msgSnippet: Very big problem is that verant dont have a time to balance classes and races and whole game to be exact for high lv thet mean after lv 29 -30. In beta there
ygData.messageBody:
Very big problem is that verant dont have a time to balance classes and
races and whole game to be exact for high lv thet mean after lv 29 -30. In
beta there vere not enough people at high lv to make a exact balancing and
until one month ago some high lv dungeons in game where with monsters
without loot you can see that a lady vox a mighty dragon is even now tuned
in. So after lv 20 wizards were untuned, what you can se with problems with
lv 20 spells.
Many players in beta jumper right from lv 10 15 to lv 40 to be able to test
high lv but they nevarly never arived normaly at lv 50. only 2 guys using
some not so legal techicues made it very fast to get at high lv. so normal
balancing of high lv classes was never made and we see it proces now in
last patchs. Wizards have a right to have its share of funn in game if they
are weak at start they have right to be relatyve strong at end of game.
They are now not masters of DD spels as max lv spell is not in game, hiden
spells are to god hiden and they also are not masters of transport and they
have very anoying time needing to meditate much more of other classes and
are much easier to die depending of power of their spells, and low
defences. They are better balanced that some other classes, and are not
weakest class in game but they need some retouch and im sure many other
classes need retouch in need to follow idea what verant put in front of
class its group roles and overall game play and time needed to get to max
power lv it is valid for all classes.





At 16.11 07/07/99 -0400, you wrote:
>I think the whole point is the game is oriented and balanced towards
>groups. Trying to hold up the pluses and minuses of an individual
>class is pointless as they are each designed to be compensated by
>another. Pennaggolan has it right and we need to view the complementary
>benefits of each class in determining its abilities.
>
>Plus after 20 Wizards don't need to ride that damn boat and that alone
>makes them worthwhile.
>
>Merauk
>21 Enchanter
>Cazic-Thule
>
>-----Original Message-----
>From: croesus
>Sent: Friday, July 02, 1999 8:13 PM
>To: .EQ.Magic
>Cc: croesus
>Subject: Re: [_EQ_Magic] Wizards
>
>From: Silverlock <croesus@...>
>
>At 01:21 PM 7/2/99 -0500, you wrote:
>
>Until you get an overpull.
>
>>From: Dan Alexander <dalex@...>
>>
>>At 01:29 PM 07/02/1999 -0400, you wrote:
>>>>>>
>>You really don't get it that Wizard's are group only. Certain classes
>can
>>solo but after level 25 no matter what class you play even necro it
>becomes
>>inefficent to solo. My friend is a level 40 Wizard and he can deal
>damage
>>just fine. A Wizzard and a Warrior are perfect for each other all you
>need
>>is a Cleric and your set. I just think you really missed the point of
>the
>>Wizard Class.
>>
>><<<<
>>
>>Last nights party consisted of a cleric, a druid, and four wizards.
>The
>>average Red lasted about 7 seconds, the Yellows lasted less than 5 - it
>>looked like nighttime over Baghdad out there. A caster-heavy party
>rocks! =)
>>
>>-Pennaggolan
>>
